page.title: 07LANDSCAPE - COITY VILLAGE
page.content: The village of Coity has changed a great deal in the last l00 years. At one time it consisted of a castle, a church and a few thatched cottages. In these cottages lived the blacksmith, the tanner and there was a baker. There are no thatched cottages in the village now and most of the original houses have been taken down. There are still some old cottages like Orchard House which they say is over 200 years old. There are quite a few old farm houses. There is a good example of an old Welsh long house near the school, it is called, TY Gwyn. The walls are stone and are three foot thick in places. Near our school is the old well where the people went for their water. It is now overgrown and the steps down to it have disappeared.
